alert.note: Alert for Northern Humboldt Interior (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 03 at 11:54AM PST until January 04 at 1:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: .A front will bring heavy rain to Del Norte and northern Humboldt Counties today. Lower elevation snowpack may rapidly melt leading to localized flooding. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PST THIS EVENING... The Flood Watch continues for * A portion of northwest California, including the following areas, Del Norte Interior and Northern Humboldt Interior. * Until 8 PM PST this evening * WHEN...From 10 AM PST this morning through this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff and snowmelt may result in flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
